intro: Dorstenia hotteana, commonly known as the Hotte's false banana, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, spirally arranged leaves that resemble the leaves of banana plants. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and rarity, it is sometimes cultivated by botanists and plant enthusiasts.
